articles.author: Tuqa Khalid
articles.title: UPDATE 1-Oman 2020 budget projects modest rise in spending, deficit at 8% of GDP
articles.description: Oman's government expects to increase spending this year by 2% to 13.2 billion rials ($34.38 billion), but its fiscal deficit will remain high at 8% of gross domestic product (GDP), its state news agency said on Wednesday.
articles.content:
(Adds figures, details, background) 
By Tuqa Khalid 
DUBAI, Jan 1 (Reuters) - Oman’s government expects to increase spending this year by 2% to 13.2 billion rials ($34.38 billion), but its fiscal deficit will remain high at 8% of gross domestic product (GDP… [+1579 chars]

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Mother of Briton jailed for alleging gang rape backs boycott of Cyprus
articles.description: Holidaymakers should boycott Cyprus after a court found a British woman guilty of lying about being gang-raped by a group of Israeli youths, the woman's mother said on Thursday.
articles.content:
LONDON (Reuters) - Holidaymakers should boycott Cyprus after a court found a British woman guilty of lying about being gang-raped by a group of Israeli youths, the woman’s mother said on Thursday. 
In a case that Britain’s foreign ministry said raised seriou… [+1333 chars]

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Soccer-Iniesta's Kobe win Emperors Cup in National Stadium opener
articles.description: Vissel Kobe, led by World Cup winners Andres Iniesta and Lukas Podolski, beat Kashima Antlers 2-0 to win the Emperors Cup final on Saturday, in the first soccer match to be played at Tokyo's National Stadium, built for this year's Olympic Games.
articles.content: TOKYO, Jan 1 (Reuters) - Vissel Kobe, led by World Cup winners Andres Iniesta and Lukas Podolski, beat Kashima Antlers 2-0 to win the Emperors Cup final on Saturday, in the first soccer match to be played at Tokyo’s National Stadium, built for this year’s Oly… [+1007 chars]

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Australia fires claim more lives
articles.description: The toll to life and property keeps rising in Australia's devastating bush fires. Julian Satterthwaite reports.
articles.content:
Posted 
The toll to life and property keeps rising in Australia's devastating bush fires. Julian Satterthwaite reports.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Protests usher in new year in Hong Kong
articles.description: Hong Kong welcomed the new year with protests spilling into the streets on New Year's Eve, as thousands of protesters marched across the city on New Year's Day. Libby Hogan reports.
articles.content:
Posted 
Hong Kong welcomed the new year with protests spilling into the streets on New Year's Eve, as thousands of protesters marched across the city on New Year's Day. Libby Hogan reports.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: French hardline union calls for more strikes to counter Macron's pension reform
articles.description: French hardline union CGT called on Wednesday for more strikes in France this month after president Emmanuel Macron pledged to push through an overhaul of the pension system following weeks of nationwide strikes by trade unions.
articles.content:
PARIS (Reuters) - French hardline union CGT called on Wednesday for more strikes in France this month after president Emmanuel Macron pledged to push through an overhaul of the pension system following weeks of nationwide strikes by trade unions.

articles.title: Trump says he does not foresee war with Iran
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump said that he does not think rising tensions with Iran will spiral into a war, though he had earlier threatened retaliation against the country, after the attack on a military base by Iranian-led militia in Baghdad, Iraq. Jayson Alb…

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Hong Kong police fire tear gas during mass New Year's day march
articles.description: Hong Kong police fired several rounds of tear gas at crowds during a New Year's day march on Wednesday that has drawn tens of thousands of people, including families with children.
articles.content:
HONG KONG (Reuters) - Hong Kong police fired several rounds of tear gas at crowds during a New Year’s day march on Wednesday that has drawn tens of thousands of people, including families with children. 
What had been a peaceful march to press authorities fo… [+625 chars]

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: China cuts banks' reserve ratios again, frees up $115 billion to spur economy
articles.description: China's central bank said on Wednesday it was cutting the amount of cash that all banks must hold as reserves, releasing around 800 billion yuan ($114.91 billion) in funds to shore up the slowing economy.
articles.content:
BEIJING (Reuters) - China’s central bank said on Wednesday it was cutting the amount of cash that all banks must hold as reserves, releasing around 800 billion yuan ($114.91 billion) in funds to shore up the slowing economy. 
The People’s Bank of China (PBOC… [+3769 chars]

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: NBA roundup: Paul lifts Thunder past Mavs down stretch
articles.description: Chris Paul scored 17 points -- including 13 in the final 4:31 -- to lead the Oklahoma City Thunder to a come-from-behind, 106-101 home win over the Dallas Mavericks on Tuesday night.
articles.content:
Chris Paul scored 17 points including 13 in the final 4:31 to lead the Oklahoma City Thunder to a come-from-behind, 106-101 home win over the Dallas Mavericks on Tuesday night. 
With less than three minutes remaining, the Thunder trailed by seven. But then O… [+4525 chars]

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Egypt has planted nearly 3 mln feddans of wheat - official
articles.description: Egypt will have planted 3 million feddans (1.26 million hectares) of wheat within the next two to three days and still aims to plant a total of 3.5 million feddans this season, an Agriculture Ministry official said on Wednesday.
articles.content:
CAIRO (Reuters) - Egypt will have planted 3 million feddans (1.26 million hectares) of wheat within the next two to three days and still aims to plant a total of 3.5 million feddans this season, an Agriculture Ministry official said on Wednesday. 
The previo… [+488 chars]

articles.author: Ahmed Aboulenein
articles.title: Iraqi militiamen hurl stones at U.S. Embassy, prepare for extended stay
articles.description: Hundreds of Iraqi militiamen and their supporters hurled stones at the U.S. Embassy in Baghdad for a second day on Wednesday and security forces fired tear gas and stun grenades to drive them away.
articles.content:
BAGHDAD (Reuters) - Hundreds of Iraqi militiamen and their supporters hurled stones at the U.S. Embassy in Baghdad for a second day on Wednesday and security forces fired tear gas and stun grenades to drive them away.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Iran's Khamenei strongly condemns U.S. attacks in Iraq - TV
articles.description: Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei strongly condemned U.S. attacks on Iran-allied militia group in Iraq, Iranian state TV reported on Wednesday, blaming the United States for the violence in the neighbouring country.
articles.content:
DUBAI (Reuters) - Iran’s Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei strongly condemned U.S. attacks on Iran-allied militia group in Iraq, Iranian state TV reported on Wednesday, blaming the United States for the violence in the neighbouring country.
